title: Toxic theology
cleaned_text: Toxic theology refers to belief systems that contain falsehoods; it does not refer to the underlying religion but rather its expression in a particular community of faith. Qualities of toxic theology are that they contain a measure of violence -- emotional, physical or spiritual -- and power abuse that compromise mental health and physical wellbeing, producing pain and suffering. Characteristics of such theology may include: Religious beliefs based on toxic theology can increase guilt, shame, fear of death and complicated grief.
